intro: Dialium eurysepalum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The fruit is a spherical, spiny capsule that turns from green to yellow when mature, containing a sweet, juicy pulp surrounding the seeds. The plant is often cultivated for its edible fruit and has traditional uses in medicine and as a source of timber. Its growth habit and ecological role make it an important species in tropical ecosystems.
